Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided information, it seems that Dimagi has taken several steps towards achieving climate neutrality. They have invested in projects related to forest and land conservation, reforestation, and marine conservation through carbon offset purchases. Additionally, they have developed a reduction plan aimed at decreasing carbon emissions from business travel. Although specific details about other sustainable practices are not mentioned, it can be inferred that Dimagi is committed to minimizing their impact on the environment and supporting regenerative initiatives.

source.content: America South America Africa and Asia and focus on regeneration investing in projects centered around Forest and Land Conservation Reforestation and Marine Conservation We have divided our offset purchases equally among seven projects Beyond purchasing carbon credits to offset Dimagi’s current emissions Climate Neutral requires each organization to develop an action plan focused on decreasing the amount of carbon emitted in the future Our plan focuses on two key areas The first is reducing emissions from business travel Business travel made up 12 of our carbon footprint in  a year where we traveled only a small percentage of what is considered “normal” for Dimagi In keeping the same travel patterns as prior to the pandemic we see our carbon emissions in this area increasing immensely Our reduction plan looks to challenge our current organizational culture around business travel to consider both the modes of transportation and necessities of travel given our recent remote year  The

more accessible set clear guidelines for carbon offsetting and inspire the reduction of carbon emissions  To become Climate Neutral Certified three key actions are required First an organization must measure its carbon footprint for the year in question Second carbon offsets must be purchased that are equivalent to the emissions generated by the company during that year And third each organization must develop a reduction plan Climate Neutral certification is dependent on the completion of each of these steps In becoming Climate Neutral certified Dimagi is joining other sustainability leaders taking responsibility for their emissions such as REI Klean Kanteen and Kickstarter From March to May  Dimagi’s Climate Neutral Working Group aggregated company-wide data using the Climate Neutral process and templates to determine Dimagi’s overall emissions for   This process included  Using Climate Neutral’s template Aggregation Workbook and their Brand Emissions Estimator software Dimagi

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
The text mentions several environmental impact metrics related to Dimagi's carbon footprint. These include:

1. Total carbon emissions (equivalent to driving over 16 million miles in a passenger vehicle)
2. Scope 1 emissions (tons of CO2e)
3. Scope 2 emissions (tons of CO2e)
4. Scope 3 emissions (tons of CO2e)
5. Global footprint (total tons of CO2e)
6. Carbon offsets purchased from Climate Neutral-approved vetted providers (Pachama and Cool Effect)
7. Projects focused on regeneration, including Forest and Land Conservation, Reforestation, and Marine Conservation

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the organization has made public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. Specifically, as a Benefit Corporation, Dimagi is legally bound to be more transparent than traditional companies. They are required to disclose their financial performance, social, and environmental impacts in regular reports. Additionally, Dimagi has chosen to prioritize certain initiatives aligned with their mission, such as becoming climate neutral certified despite additional costs. These actions demonstrate Dimagi's dedication to responsible business practices and making a positive impact on society and the environment.

source.content: for all organizations But as a formally structured Benefit Corporation we’re legally required to be more transparent than traditional companies Benefit Corporations have to make our financial performance regularly available to employees and the world as well as our social and environmental performance too This is shared in an annual report card that is made publicly available for anyone to review I joined Dimagi at a moment when the world felt increasingly inequitable and scary out of a desire to do something I can be proud of when I retire I love to work and I want to translate that passion into impact It’s no secret that the global wealth gap continues to widen but increasing inequity in the digital world can be easier to miss The COVID-19 pandemic laid bare the underlying reality that the Big Tech engine dominating the growth of technology can’t be relied on to solve our biggest problems and our underserved communities are falling further and further behind as markets consolidate

vein as an organization we must make business decisions looking through the lenses of all impacted stakeholders Each year we submit a mandatory impact report separate from the BIA to the state of Massachusetts that outlines our social and environmental impact The nature of electing into this status focuses a lot on what we have to do to comply but I think the true essence is in what we get to do in return As a Benefit corporation Dimagi gets to choose the partners and projects we work on based on their alignment with our mission not solely on the revenue they bring in We get to take an environmental stand and become Climate Neutral certified even though there is a cost to offsetting our carbon footprint  The Benefit corporation status is a protective forcefield for companies breaking out of a more traditional business model It not only sets a baseline for defining purpose but preserves it from shareholder pressure leadership transitions and changes in the business environment that

the largest financially sustainable social enterprises We’re able to take on risks that we couldn’t before including acquiring our first company SureAdhere to expand our portfolio of digital health solutions And we’ve actually had enough headspace to create our first five-year strategy towards High-impact Growth In support of the next 5 years at Dimagi we recently announced the Steele Foundation for Hope’s transformative investment of 25 million in Dimagi towards building our technology platform CommCare to support improving jobs to improve outcomes This investment is the largest Dimagi has secured to date and will go a long way in accelerating our five-year strategy In addition to these milestones from the past year there are two other big ones that jump out to me when I reflect on our sustainability as an organization Looking back on the last 20 years has been wonderful and makes me excited about the next 20 As we continue to grow stretch and challenge ourselves towards creating

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Based on the provided information about Carter and Erin's backgrounds, it can be inferred that their work at Dimagi involves providing customer success management for clients using mobile technologies in various sectors such as education, health, and agriculture. These clients range from grassroots organizations to government ministries. Additionally, Dimagi offers a platform called CommCare which is designed to help organizations develop and implement mobile data collection solutions. This platform enables users to create custom surveys, forms, and workflows for data collection and analysis. Therefore, some of the key products and technologies offered by Dimagi include mobile data collection solutions, particularly those utilizing the CommCare platform.

source.content: services and products Carter holds a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology MIT He has spent his prior professional life working in management consulting and finance with Oliver Wyman managing multiple international projects across North America Africa Asia Europe and the Middle East Prior to joining Dimagi Carter was also a Senior Associate at ideas42 a Harvard-based think tank applying behavioral economics to design financial products for the poor Erin Quinn is a Customer Success Managernbsp; at Dimagi where she works with diverse clients ranging from grassroots organizations to government ministries to enable the effective use of mobile technologies in education health and agriculture Erin has worked on 15+ mobile technology projects across Asia and Africa Most recently she has worked on large-scale digital system for tracking and enhancing care for tuberculosis patients in India Prior to Dimagi she worked for

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs related to the Solutions Delivery team. Some of these include:

1. Job Fairs: Division-wide job fairs are held periodically where representatives from different teams within the organization showcase their roles and opportunities. These events provide a platform for networking and learning more about available positions.
2. Webinars: Regular webinars are conducted by the organization to share updates, best practices, and insights into the work done by the Solutions Delivery team. These webinars are open to both internal employees and external participants who may be interested in joining the team.
3. Workshops: The organization often conducts workshops focused on developing specific skills relevant to the Solutions Delivery team, such as project management, technical aspects of CommCare, and communication. These workshops are usually offered internally or through partner organizations.
4. Training Programs: There are comprehensive training programs designed to help new hires familiarize themselves with the organization's culture, processes, and tools. Additionally, ongoing training opportunities are provided throughout one's career to support continuous learning and development.

source.content: Training is a critical piece of any CommCare project and requires careful planning In this section you will find several training resources to get you started on planning a CommCare training To get ready for training you will need to think about

to build an understanding of what other people are working on We have division-wide meetings and then separate team meetings for members in a particular region We also have capacity-building sessions for those interested in growing their knowledge in a specific area like project management or technical aspects of CommCare On project teams we pair people up to travel together when possible Team members in the same country or region come together a few times a year for face-to-face interaction What advice would you give to someone looking to pursue a career in the Solutions Delivery team To be successful on the Delivery team communication skills are critical Almost everyone on the team works on 2-3 projects simultaneously so communicating with your team members and partners to get questions answered and keep the tasks moving forward is essential For the same reason task management is also crucial to structure your work and manage tasks across projects This can be challenging for someone

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
As an organization focused on social impact, Dimagi offers various benefits to its employees and participants. Some key benefits mentioned include:

* Health insurance premiums for employees and their dependents, along with an employer-sponsored HSA (Health Savings Account).
* A flexible work schedule with 30 days of paid time off.
* Opportunities for international travel to learn, meet with colleagues abroad, and see project work in action.
* Provident Fund in India and a Retirement Fund in South Africa, which come with company matching.
* Professional development benefits to help employees advance their careers at Dimagi.
* A diverse, inclusive, and collaborative work culture.
* Support for both professional and personal needs.

source.content: As a social enterprise we couldn’t agree more that a shared sense of purpose is a powerful unifying force” Jonathan Jackson CEO of Dimagi said “At Dimagi we develop and deploy technology to impact people in need This shared goal of creating impact bonds us and creates a fulfilling work environment for our employees” Rikimah Glymph Global Director of People Operations at Dimagi shared a few highlights from Dimagi’s benefits package “Work perks are important; we want our employees to feel rewarded” Glymph said “We strive to provide our employees with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including  health insurance premiums for employees and their dependents paired with an employer sponsored HSA a flexible work schedule with 30-days of paid time off and opportunities for international travel to learn meet with our colleagues abroad and see our project work in action” Glymph shared how her team listens and takes feedback on the benefits package seriously We recently added

for all organizations But as a formally structured Benefit Corporation we’re legally required to be more transparent than traditional companies Benefit Corporations have to make our financial performance regularly available to employees and the world as well as our social and environmental performance too This is shared in an annual report card that is made publicly available for anyone to review I joined Dimagi at a moment when the world felt increasingly inequitable and scary out of a desire to do something I can be proud of when I retire I love to work and I want to translate that passion into impact It’s no secret that the global wealth gap continues to widen but increasing inequity in the digital world can be easier to miss The COVID-19 pandemic laid bare the underlying reality that the Big Tech engine dominating the growth of technology can’t be relied on to solve our biggest problems and our underserved communities are falling further and further behind as markets consolidate

Provident Fund in India and a Retirement Fund in South Africa; all of our retirement benefits include company matching Access to a professional development benefit to advance your career at Dimagi You’ll have a stake in the future success of Dimagi Diverse Inclusive Collaborative Come for the mission Stay for the team “Work/life balance is essential if you want your employees to be the best version of themselves And at Dimagi this is the foundation of the culture I am proud to be part of the Dimagi family” “I feel lucky to have great mentors at Dimagi who care about my success I am here becuase I continue to learn something new every day and I continue to grow every day” “The human side is very valued at Dimagi you always find support on both a professional and personal level” “What I love the most about Dimagi is the fact that we are a very collaborative team we work across different geographies different time zones and I’ve never felt that I’m talking to a stranger” Dimagi’s CTO

and did a retrospective on our retrospectives There were lots of new insights and knowledge gained that the team is excited to pursue further As a tech team we love to learn and are continuously seeking ways to increase our knowledge so we spent time discussing the way we share knowledge and how we can improve on this going forward The team spent some time discussing our developer recruitment process and how the process can be streamlined We are excited to see some of the ideas from this session being implemented in the future We also discussed our code review process and how we create design documentation The team also looked at ways in which we can reframe our non-programming roles Although we learnt a lot and produced wonderful ideas that we can implement in the future the highlight of the summit was how the team focused on getting to know each other better We spent a lot of time around the fire each night telling stories and sharing meals and drinks together During the day we went

source.content: and expanding our ecosystem In order to achieve our first two strategic priorities we need to exceed market expectations by fully satisfying our partners’ priorities while delivering additional value on areas we think are essential Over the next five years we will seek to exceed our market’s expectations by creatively over-delivering on value today while shaping market alignment and raising expectations for tomorrow We will achieve ‘High-Impact Growth’ by fully meeting our partner priorities in addition to our own while playing our own small part in advocating for changes to our markets  To execute our five-year strategy each of our divisions and Dimagi as a whole have developed associated annual strategies with clearly defined intentions goals action plans and KPIs While it’s been fun to roll out our strategy internally as a company I’m thrilled to share it with the world Please feel free to read the full five-year strategy here As we set out on this journey I look forward to sharing

Vanessa is a Grants  Finance Associate at Dimagi based in Lexington Kentucky In this role Vanessa supports the broader Project Finance team in managing of the financial contractual and administrative requirements of Dimagi’s projects Her enthusiasm for governmental and fund accounting led her to various roles prior to Dimagi including Save the Children US; local state government as well as higher educational institutions Vanessa holds an MBA from Emporia State University and a bachelor’s degree in Accounting from Eastern Kentucky University When not at work she enjoys spending time with family and friends traveling camping and practicing hot yoga Over 32 leaders from WHO Save the Children the World Bank USAID the Bill  Melinda Gates Foundation and many other impact-driven organizations subscribe to our newsletter for case studies best practices and other updates Join them today

Research & Innovation.question: Are there any ongoing or upcoming research projects or innovation initiatives? If yes then list them
Research & Innovation.result:
Based on the provided information, there are several ongoing and upcoming research projects and innovation initiatives involving Dimagi. Some of these include:

1. Agriculture Sector Digital Solution Expansion - Dimagi is currently exploring opportunities to expand its digital solution dedicated to the agricultural sector, aiming to reach an additional 2 smallholder farmers.
2. Economic Resilience Support Project (PAREC) - Dimagi collaborated with the Cameroonian government and the UNDP to launch the PAREC project, focused on reducing poverty and inequality at the local level.
3. Finding Nutrition Survey Tool - Dimagi partnered with Tufts University and IITA to design and build a nutrition survey tool for low- and middle-income countries (LMICs), supporting IITA's national food consumption survey in Nigeria.
4. Malaria Elimination Group (MEG) Vaccine Delivery System - Dimagi is working with the Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation (EGPAF)-Malawi to design, develop, and test a pilot mobile solution that supports testing of children and partners potentially at risk of malaria.
5. COVID-19 Vaccine Delivery Management System - Dimagi played a crucial role in the development and implementation of a CommCare-based system for managing COVID-19 vaccine delivery across Somalia, in collaboration with the Government of Somalia, the regional WHO team, and Dimagi itself.
6. EGPAF-Malawi Mobile Solutions Pilot - Dimagi is involved in designing, developing, and testing a pilot mobile solution that will support testing of children and partners possibly affected by malaria in Malawi, in cooperation with EGPAF-Malawi.

Melissa is an Albuquerque-based Partnerships Analyst working on the US Health team Prior to joining Dimagi she worked in public and non-profit housing and delved into social entrepreneurship as the owner and confectioner of a vegan candy company Melissa is deeply interested in the intersection of policy development project coordination and communications She earned dual BA degrees in Anthropology and Sociology from Agnes Scott College in Decatur Georgia and has completed certifications in social policy and change management In her free time Melissa enjoys volunteering at museums exploring parks and national forests failing to train her two cats and baking She has seldom met a rock she didn’t like Over 32 leaders from WHO Save the Children the World Bank USAID the Bill  Melinda Gates Foundation and many other impact-driven organizations subscribe to our newsletter for case studies best practices and other updates Join them today

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The given text does not explicitly mention the specific mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations between Dimagi and various organizations such as WHO, Save the Children, the World Bank, USAID, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, etc. However, it can be inferred that the main objective of these collaborations is to promote the equitable use of Low Literacy Mobile (LLM) technologies in order to achieve their respective missions. This collaboration aims to develop and implement impactful, equitable, robust, and scalable digital solutions that can have a positive social impact on communities around the world. By working together, these organizations hope to learn from each other, share knowledge, resources, and expertise, which will ultimately lead to better outcomes for the people they serve.
